messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Newcomer looking for help and advice.
messages.msgSnippet: Mike, I agree with Rich s advice.  I hope that you ll stick around, but there isn t much discussion of swordsmithing here. Jim ... You ll more likely find the
messages.messageBody:
Mike,
I agree with Rich's advice. I hope that you'll stick around, but there isn't much discussion of swordsmithing here.

Jim
------------
You'll more likely find the info you want at

http://swordforum.com

Check out their bladesmiths forum.

Rich S

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Newcomer looking for help and advice.
messages.msgSnippet: ... You ll more likely find the info you want at http://swordforum.com Check out their bladesmiths forum. Rich S ... Richard Stein, PhD
messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "teyrnaedan" <teyrnaedan@y...>
wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I am new to this list and to the sword study. I am trying to learn
> about swordmaking. I want to learn to be able to forge swords using
> the traditional methods. I live near Orlando, Florida and seem to
> be having trouble finding educational resources. Any help that
> anyone can provide will be greatly appreciated.
>
> Mike

You'll more likely find the info you want at

http://swordforum.com

Check out their bladesmiths forum.

Rich S
------------------------------------------------------------
Richard Stein, PhD alchemyst@...

The Japanese Sword Index
http://www.geocities.com/alchemyst/nihonto.htm
------------------------------------------------------------

messages.subject: Newcomer looking for help and advice.
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, I am new to this list and to the sword study.  I am trying to learn about swordmaking.  I want to learn to be able to forge swords using the traditional
messages.messageBody:
Hello,

I am new to this list and to the sword study. I am trying to learn
about swordmaking. I want to learn to be able to forge swords using
the traditional methods. I live near Orlando, Florida and seem to
be having trouble finding educational resources. Any help that
anyone can provide will be greatly appreciated.

Mike

messages.messageBody:
Hello,

I am new to this list and to the sword study. I am trying to learn
about swordmaking. I want to learn to be able to forge swords using
the traditional methods. I live near Orlando, Florida and seem to
be having trouble finding educational resources. Any help that
anyone can provide will be greatly appreciated.

Mike
